sentences.en: Along came a meadow mouse, no bigger than an acorn.
sentences.cn: 抑制小仓鼠也来了, 它比橡栗一般大小.

sentences.en: An acorn grows into an oak.
Every oak has been an acorn.
sentences.cn: 千里之行,始于足下.由小到大.

sentences.en: Every oak must be an acorn.
First an acorn; then an oak tree forest.
sentences.cn: 先有一颗橡子, 然后有了一片橡树森林.

sentences.en: For example, the bridal rose symbolizes happiness, the oak and the acorn symbolize endurance ... and we have a long list.
sentences.cn: 例如，新娘玫瑰象征着幸福，橡树和橡子象征着耐力...我们有长长的名单。

sentences.en: How could you mistake a stop sign for an acorn?
sentences.cn: 你怎么能把停止牌错当成橡树果?

sentences.en: My mother uses the acorn harvested to make acorn flour.
sentences.cn: 每年妈妈都把收获的橡子做成橡子面.

sentences.en: The acorn ripens and the hickory nut matures.
The greatest oak still has to grow from a tiny acorn.
sentences.cn: 最高大的橡树也是从小小的种子生长而成.

sentences.en: The lofty oak from a small acorn grows.
The oak is implicit in the acorn.
The tree grew from a small acorn.
sentences.cn: 橡树从一粒小橡子生长而来.

sentences.en: To see the problem here more clearly, let's look at a different biological system, say, an acorn.
sentences.cn: 为更清晰地理解此处的问题，我们来看一种不同的生物系统，比如说，橡子。

sentences.en: We watched the bird an acorn.
sentences.cn: 我们看着鸟摘下一只橡树果.

sentences.en: We will live on acorn noodles for the winter this year.
sentences.cn: 今年冬天,我们家就靠橡子面生活.

trans.tran_en: the nut of the  oak  tree
